oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Non compliance in organic certification: determinants for Italy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gambelli, Danilo
Solfanelli, Francesco
Zanoli, Raffaele
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Regulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic certification is based on controls on operators, and verify if they are compliant with respect to organic regulations. Control procedures are a transaction cost that affect organic farming relative competiveness. Here we propose an analysis aiming at increasing the efficiency in the individuation of key risk factors in the organic certification process. The study refers to Italian organic farmers and represents an attempt to implement a risk based inspection scheme based on a statistical approach.
